mainStory.paragraph1: I'm Anna David, and I bring a lifelong passion for languages and teaching to every lesson.
mainStory.paragraph2: Born and raised in the United States, I developed a deep love for reading and languages from an early age. I studied history, foreign languages (French, Latin, Russian, and Spanish), and creative writing at the University of Memphis, while also volunteering to teach English to new immigrants.
mainStory.paragraph3: After making aliyah to Israel in 2019, I pursued my dream of becoming a professional English teacher. In January 2025, I completed the prestigious CELTA certification (Certificate in English Language Teaching to Adults), where I was mentored by experienced EFL teachers and taught students from around the world.
mainStory.highlights:
During my training, I received high marks for:
- Creating authentic, engaging lesson materials
- Building strong connections with students
- Designing relevant, practical lessons that make learning enjoyable
mainStory.paragraph4: Now, I'm dedicated to helping you achieve your English goals through personalized, one-on-one instruction tailored to your specific needs and learning style.

philosophy.title: Teaching Philosophy
philosophy.content: Every student is unique, with their own goals, learning style, and pace. That's why I don't believe in one-size-fits-all teaching. Instead, I create a completely personalized learning experience for each student, using materials and methods that are relevant to your life and interests. Whether you're preparing for a business presentation, planning a trip abroad, or simply want to feel more confident speaking English, we'll work together to get you there.

expectations.title: My Expectations from Students
expectations.intro: Learning a language is a partnership. To get the most from our lessons, I ask that you:
items: ✓ Come Prepared - Arrive ready to engage and participate actively
✓ Practice Consistently - Complete exercises and practice between lessons
✓ Be Patient - Progress takes time; trust the process
✓ Communicate Openly - Tell me what's working and what isn't
✓ Use English Daily - Try to practice outside our lessons when possible
expectations.closing: I'm here to guide, support, and challenge you—but your commitment is what makes real progress possible. Together, we'll achieve your English goals.
